name: couscous tfaya
ingredients: 200g of lamb pieces (optional, or other vegetables for a vegetarian version)
For the onion and raisin confit: 3 red onions, 50g of raisins, 3 tbsp of sugar, 2 tsp of ground cinnamon
For garnish: 2 hard-boiled eggs, 1 handful of roasted almonds
steps: Prepare the semolina: Pour the couscous grains into a bowl, add salt and olive oil, rub the grains. Add a large glass of water, let it absorb, rub again. Repeat 2-3 times. Then place in the top of the couscoussier.

Prepare the meat broth: In the bottom of the couscoussier, brown the meat (if used) in olive oil. Add the spices, the chopped onion, a liter of water, and the bouillon cube. Let it cook for about twenty minutes.
Steam the semolina (in the top of the couscoussier). When the steam passes through, pour it into a large bowl, let it cool, and rub it. Steam it again.

Prepare the Tfaya (onion and raisin confit): Slice the onions. Cook them with a drizzle of olive oil and cover with water. Let them simmer until the water evaporates. Add the pre-soaked raisins, cinnamon, sugar, and one or two ladles of broth (taken from the bottom of the couscoussier). Mix well.
Serve the couscous in a dome shape, with the meat and tfaya on top. Garnish with sliced hard-boiled eggs and roasted almonds.
